category_system.description: Korean profanity categorization system adapted for hierarchical culture and speech levels
category_system.methodology: Based on Korean Confucian hierarchy, speech level system (jondaetmal/banmal), and modern internet culture

general.name: 일반적인 욕설 (General Profanity)
general.description: Common swear words and expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration
general.cultural_context: Strong emphasis on respect levels and age hierarchy affects severity

insult.name: 모욕어 (Personal Insults)
insult.description: Direct personal attacks and derogatory terms targeting individuals
insult.cultural_context: Direct insults violate Korean concepts of nunchi (social awareness) and face-saving

sexual.name: 성적인 언어 (Sexual Content)
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content
sexual.cultural_context: Sexual content extremely taboo in traditional Korean society, heavy Confucian influence

violence.name: 폭력적인 언어 (Violence and Threats)
violence.description: Words promoting violence, threats, or aggressive behavior
violence.cultural_context: Violence threats taken very seriously, conflicts with Korean harmony values

hate_speech.name: 혐오 발언 (Hate Speech)
hate_speech.description: Language targeting groups based on identity, nationality, or characteristics
hate_speech.cultural_context: Korea's ethnic homogeneity creates unique patterns of discrimination

family_honor.name: 가족 모독 (Family Honor Attacks)
family_honor.description: Attacks on family members, especially parents and ancestors
family_honor.examples_note: Violations of filial piety and family respect
family_honor.cultural_context: Attacking family honor is one of the most serious offenses in Korean culture

subcategories.parent_insults: Direct attacks on parents (ni eomma, ni appa)

hierarchy_violation.name: 위계질서 위반 (Hierarchy Violations)
hierarchy_violation.description: Language that violates Korean age and status hierarchy
hierarchy_violation.examples_note: Inappropriate speech levels and respect violations
hierarchy_violation.cultural_context: Korean society heavily structured by age and status hierarchy

internet_gaming.name: 인터넷/게임 욕설 (Internet/Gaming Slang)
internet_gaming.description: Modern internet and gaming community profanity
internet_gaming.cultural_context: Korea's advanced internet culture has developed unique online profanity

generational.name: 세대갈등 언어 (Generational Conflict Language)
generational.description: Terms used in intergenerational conflicts and social criticism
generational.cultural_context: Rapid social change has created significant generational tensions

1.description: Generally acceptable among friends but inappropriate in formal settings
1.korean_context: Same-age friends or casual situations only

2.description: Inappropriate in most social settings, offensive to many

3.description: Highly offensive and damaging to relationships

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially relationship-ending or legally problematic
4.korean_context: Complete social ostracism, potential legal consequences

jondaetmal.name: 존댓말 (Honorific Speech)
jondaetmal.description: Formal speech requiring different profanity assessment

banmal.name: 반말 (Casual Speech)
banmal.description: Informal speech where some profanity may be more acceptable

nunchi.name: 눈치 (Social Awareness)
nunchi.description: Context-dependent appropriateness based on social reading

cultural_factors.confucian_influence: Confucian values heavily influence severity perception
cultural_factors.face_saving: Preserving face and avoiding shame is paramount
cultural_factors.generational_change: Rapid social change creates different standards across generations
